questions.question_text: Which of the following is the purpose of an industry-standard framework?

choices.D: To provide guidance across common system implementations
choices.A: To promulgate compliance requirements for sales of common IT systems
choices.B: To provide legal relief to participating organizations in the event of a security breach
choices.C: To promulgate security settings on a vendor-by-vendor basis

discussion.content:
Ya D
ISO 27032 is the international standard offering guidance on cybersecurity management. It provides guidance on addressing a wide range of cybersecurity risks, including user endpoint security, network security, and critical infrastructure protection

questions.question_text: Which of the following physical security controls is MOST effective when trying to prevent tailgating?

comments.content: Thanks - Happy Holidays and Good Luck!

For what it's worth I wrote it today and managed to pass with a 830 but almost none of the questions were in this dump, including both topic 1 and topic 2. This dump certainly helped me obviously, but do your due diligence and learn why each answer is correct/incorrect, that's the most reliable way to pass.
I can't seem to find topic 2 on here. Can somebody please help?
can you shed some light on the type of pbqs pls.

Scored 850. I had seen 85-90% of the questions from topic 2 especially the later questions. I didn't bother with topic 1. I reviewed all of topic 2 three times and depended on comments when questions were iffy and def reviewed all comments and trusted Duranio over any others

discussion.content: Its been a good ride. 1018 questions later. Ill update on Saturday
i thought it could have been faraday cage but that's not an option :(

comments.content: Best of luck! Let us know how you did!

discussion.content:
Down to the last question. Fingers crossed , Im taking this test 4/28. May the force be with me.

PS: Listen to Duranio and ignore Melvin

2 of 2 I did not study anything outside of these two websites. To be clear, I am not saying I memorized answers, but rather I genuinely read the discussions and lived on Google while reading these Q&As. Now onto the test. Out of the 1000+ questions across both of these sites, maybe 10 were on the test. Almost every single question on the test was the first time I has seen it. Be aware if you are just trying to memorize answers without knowing why you are answering. I scored an 813. So yay! Thank you to all those who contributed to the discussions. It provides those of us who do not specialize in one area with a sliver of understanding on how to navigate the various areas of the IT world. Good luck everyone who tests after me! And take care.

1 of 2 Hey all, just wanted to provide an update as I tested on 3/26/21. As background, I have ONLY ever been on the leadership/PM side of the house (2007-present)--so, I have a mile-wide understanding of a great many areas, but only an inch deep of any given area. Thus, when studying, I had a basic understanding of ~60% of the terms (e.g. GPO) and their uses (e.g. block USB devices). This is one example. I ended up going through this site, as well as, certification-questions.com. I'd say 80% of the questions were on both sites, but the latter site did have questions that weren't here. As others have said, the discussion areas are invaluable for all those like me just don't have a specialization. I would also say it is important to understand that security-minded folks made this test--not operators/engineers. There are many questions where the broader community is convinced the rendered answer is incorrect. Stated otherwise, in some cases with this test, there is a test answer and a real life answer. Try to balance that concept

comments.content: Wow, your experience was so much different from others here.

discussion.content: Hi guys, I just got 800 on my comptia exam.From all the questions here I got only 2 and one of them was practice picture (cable locks,biometer etc for each device).I suggest you read Gibson book and check sunny classroom or nuggets.This question helped only in understanding what type of question i will get.Hope this helps.LMK if you got questions
Good Luck AlechChen keep us updated.

choices.B: Require the consultants to sign an agreement stating they will only use the company-provided email address for communications during the project
choices.D: Require the consultants to connect to the company VPN when accessing confidential resources
choices.A: Require that all consultant activity be restricted to a secure VDI environment
choices.C: Require updated antivirus, USB blocking, and a host-based firewall on all consultant devices

questions.question_text:
A software development company needs to augment staff by hiring consultants for a high-stakes project. The project has the following requirements:
✑ Consultants will have access to highly confidential, proprietary data.
✑ Consultants will not be provided with company-owned assets.
✑ Work needs to start immediately.
✑ Consultants will be provided with internal email addresses for communications.
Which of the following solutions is the BEST method for controlling data exfiltration during this project?
